title: Multithreading Scaling Issue with MKL
body_html:
Trying to optimize my intel CPU and reach the performance mentioned here through muli-threading:

I build the binaries using MKL blas with OpenMP enabled. I'm running convnet_benchmark.py as mentioned in the link above.

I'm changing the number of threads using both OMP_NUM_THREADS and MKL_NUM_THREADS.
If I increase number of threads using the former the performance drops, if I use the latter it does nothing.

Anyone else has seen similar issues?
body_text:
Trying to optimize my intel CPU and reach the performance mentioned here through muli-threading:
I build the binaries using MKL blas with OpenMP enabled. I'm running convnet_benchmark.py as mentioned in the link above.
I'm changing the number of threads using both OMP_NUM_THREADS and MKL_NUM_THREADS.
If I increase number of threads using the former the performance drops, if I use the latter it does nothing.
Anyone else has seen similar issues?
body:
Trying to optimize my intel CPU and reach the performance mentioned [here](https://software.intel.com/en-us/blogs/2017/04/18/intel-and-facebook-collaborate-to-boost-caffe2-performance-on-intel-cpu-s) through muli-threading:

I build the binaries using MKL blas with OpenMP enabled. I'm running [convnet_benchmark.py](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/caffe2/python/convnet_benchmarks.py) as mentioned in the link above. 

I'm changing the number of threads using both OMP_NUM_THREADS and MKL_NUM_THREADS.
If I increase number of threads using the former the performance drops, if I use the latter it does nothing.

Anyone else has seen similar issues?
